block-definition.s: connect 2 routers: %'first router name' %'second router name'

custom-block.s: distance between x1 %s y1 %s x2 %s y2 %s

block-definition.s: set up network with routers: %'routers' and connections: %'router pairs'
distance between x1 %'x1' y1 %'y1' x2 %'x2' y2 %'y2'
ᵇʲᶜ connect 2 routers: %'first router name' %'second router name'

custom-block.s: distance between x1 %s y1 %s x2 %s y2 %s

block-definition.s: send message from router %'start router name' to router %'end router name' with strategy %'strategy'

custom-block.s: next router from %s to %s with strategy %s
send message from router %s to router %s with strategy %s

block.l: Can't find a next router in the path! 🙁
Can't find the start router, check the router name.

block-definition.s: next router from %'current router name' to %'end router name' with strategy %'strategy'

scripts.comment: check if end router name is in direct connections
Only use if its also in direct connections (Its possible that its been cut off!)
otherwise check lookup table to decide which connection to use

block-definition.s: cut cable between router %'start router name' and router %'end router name'

custom-block.s: midpoint between x1 %s y1 %s x2 %s y2 %s

block.l: Routers aren't directly connected, don't know which wire to cut.
Can't find router(s), check the names.

block-definition.s: find direct connections from router %'router name'
midpoint between x1 %'x1' y1 %'y1' x2 %'x2' y2 %'y2'

block.l: Can't find router, check the name.

custom-block.s: midpoint between x1 %s y1 %s x2 %s y2 %s

scripts.comment: draw a white line from midpoint to router data

custom-block.s: send message from router %s to router %s with strategy %s
cut cable between router %s and router %s
